result.reason: RDP ActiveX credential dialog 'More choices' interaction likely triggers unhandled COM events or causes null/disposed object access in RDP event handlers during NLA authentication.
result.approach: Add null/dispose guards in RDP COM event handlers (OnLogonError, OnFatalError, OnDisconnected) to handle credential UI state transitions gracefully during 'More choices' interaction.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my analysis of the RDP protocol implementation in the codebase, I can now produce the triage for this issue.

The "More choices" link appears in the RDP ActiveX control's embedded credential dialog (used during NLA/CredSSP authentication). When clicked, the credential UI expands and may fire COM events or resize the embedded control in ways `RdpProtocol.cs` doesn't guard against â€” likely causing a null reference or ObjectDisposedException in the event handler chain.
